title: How to Make Simple Onion Soup

steps.headline: Cut two medium-sized onions into small wedges of about 2 cm/1 inch long.
Put the onions into a bowl.
Add enough water to cover the onions.
steps.description: Then double that amount of water, so you will have twice the amount of water you would need to cover the onions.

steps.headline: Cut a clove of garlic into small pieces and it to the onions.
Cut another medium-sized onion into slices.
Boil the original onion mixture until the onions are completely cooked.
Fry the sliced onion until golden brown.
Add the fried onion to the boiled onion stew.
Add salt and any required spices.
steps.description: Add a teaspoon of cornflour and stir well. This is optional; it helps to thicken the soup and make it less gruel-like.

steps.headline: Simmer the soup for about 5 minutes.
Ladle into soup bowls and serve.
